string: ACT I
SCENE I. London. The Parliament-house.
Alarum. Enter YORK, EDWARD, RICHARD, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, WARWICK, and Soldiers
WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: I wonder how the king escaped our hands.
speaker: WARWICK

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: While we pursued the horsemen of the north,
speaker: YORK

string: He slily stole away and left his men:
speaker: YORK

string: Whereat the great Lord of Northumberland,
speaker: YORK

string: Whose warlike ears could never brook retreat,
speaker: YORK

string: Cheer'd up the drooping army; and himself,
speaker: YORK

string: Lord Clifford and Lord Stafford, all abreast,
speaker: YORK

string: Charged our main battle's front, and breaking in
speaker: YORK

string: Were by the swords of common soldiers slain.
speaker: YORK

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: Lord Stafford's father, Duke of Buckingham,
speaker: EDWARD

string: Is either slain or wounded dangerously;
speaker: EDWARD

string: I cleft his beaver with a downright blow:
speaker: EDWARD

string: That this is true, father, behold his blood.
speaker: EDWARD

string: MONTAGUE
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: And, brother, here's the Earl of Wiltshire's blood,
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: Whom I encounter'd as the battles join'd.
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Speak thou for me and tell them what I did.
speaker: RICHARD

string: Throwing down SOMERSET's head
YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Richard hath best deserved of all my sons.
speaker: YORK

string: But is your grace dead, my Lord of Somerset?
speaker: YORK

string: NORFOLK
speaker: NORFOLK

string: Such hope have all the line of John of Gaunt!
speaker: NORFOLK

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Thus do I hope to shake King Henry's head.
speaker: RICHARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: And so do I. Victorious Prince of York,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Before I see thee seated in that throne
speaker: WARWICK

string: Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,
speaker: WARWICK

string: I vow by heaven these eyes shall never close.
speaker: WARWICK

string: This is the palace of the fearful king,
speaker: WARWICK

string: And this the regal seat: possess it, York;
speaker: WARWICK

string: For this is thine and not King Henry's heirs'
speaker: WARWICK

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Assist me, then, sweet Warwick, and I will;
speaker: YORK

string: For hither we have broken in by force.
speaker: YORK

string: NORFOLK
speaker: NORFOLK

string: We'll all assist you; he that flies shall die.
speaker: NORFOLK

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Thanks, gentle Norfolk: stay by me, my lords;
speaker: YORK

string: And, soldiers, stay and lodge by me this night.
speaker: YORK

string: They go up
WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: And when the king comes, offer no violence,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Unless he seek to thrust you out perforce.
speaker: WARWICK

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: The queen this day here holds her parliament,
speaker: YORK

string: But little thinks we shall be of her council:
speaker: YORK

string: By words or blows here let us win our right.
speaker: YORK

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Arm'd as we are, let's stay within this house.
speaker: RICHARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: The bloody parliament shall this be call'd,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Unless Plantagenet, Duke of York, be king,
speaker: WARWICK

string: And bashful Henry deposed, whose cowardice
speaker: WARWICK

string: Hath made us by-words to our enemies.
speaker: WARWICK

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Then leave me not, my lords; be resolute;
speaker: YORK

string: I mean to take possession of my right.
speaker: YORK

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Neither the king, nor he that loves him best,
speaker: WARWICK

string: The proudest he that holds up Lancaster,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Dares stir a wing, if Warwick shake his bells.
speaker: WARWICK

string: I'll plant Plantagenet, root him up who dares:
speaker: WARWICK

string: Resolve thee, Richard; claim the English crown.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND, WESTMORELAND, EXETER, and the rest
KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: My lords, look where the sturdy rebel sits,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Even in the chair of state: belike he means,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Back'd by the power of Warwick, that false peer,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To aspire unto the crown and reign as king.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Earl of Northumberland, he slew thy father.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And thine, Lord Clifford; and you both have vow'd revenge
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: On him, his sons, his favourites and his friends.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: If I be not, heavens be revenged on me!
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: The hope thereof makes Clifford mourn in steel.
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WESTMORELAND
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: What, shall we suffer this? let's pluck him down:
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: My heart for anger burns; I cannot brook it.
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Be patient, gentle Earl of Westmoreland.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Patience is for poltroons, such as he:
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: He durst not sit there, had your father lived.
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: My gracious lord, here in the parliament
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Let us assail the family of York.
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Well hast thou spoken, cousin: be it so.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ah, know you not the city favours them,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And they have troops of soldiers at their beck?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: But when the duke is slain, they'll quickly fly.
speaker: EXETER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Far be the thought of this from Henry's heart,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To make a shambles of the parliament-house!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Cousin of Exeter, frowns, words and threats
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Shall be the war that Henry means to use.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thou factious Duke of York, descend my throne,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: and kneel for grace and mercy at my feet;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: I am thy sovereign.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: I am thine.
speaker: YORK

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: For shame, come down: he made thee Duke of York.
speaker: EXETER

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: 'Twas my inheritance, as the earldom was.
speaker: YORK

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: Thy father was a traitor to the crown.
speaker: EXETER

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Exeter, thou art a traitor to the crown
speaker: WARWICK

string: In following this usurping Henry.
speaker: WARWICK

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Whom should he follow but his natural king?
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: True, Clifford; and that's Richard Duke of York.
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And shall I stand, and thou sit in my throne?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: It must and shall be so: content thyself.
speaker: YORK

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Be Duke of Lancaster; let him be king.
speaker: WARWICK

string: WESTMORELAND
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: He is both king and Duke of Lancaster;
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: And that the Lord of Westmoreland shall maintain.
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: And Warwick shall disprove it. You forget
speaker: WARWICK

string: That we are those which chased you from the field
speaker: WARWICK

string: And slew your fathers, and with colours spread
speaker: WARWICK

string: March'd through the city to the palace gates.
speaker: WARWICK

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: And, by his soul, thou and thy house shall rue it.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: WESTMORELAND
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: Plantagenet, of thee and these thy sons,
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: Thy kinsman and thy friends, I'll have more lives
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: Than drops of blood were in my father's veins.
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Urge it no more; lest that, instead of words,
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: I send thee, Warwick, such a messenger
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: As shall revenge his death before I stir.
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Poor Clifford! how I scorn his worthless threats!
speaker: WARWICK

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Will you we show our title to the crown?
speaker: YORK

string: If not, our swords shall plead it in the field.
speaker: YORK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: What title hast thou, traitor, to the crown?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thy father was, as thou art, Duke of York;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thy grandfather, Roger Mortimer, Earl of March:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: I am the son of Henry the Fifth,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And seized upon their towns and provinces.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Talk not of France, sith thou hast lost it all.
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The lord protector lost it, and not I:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: When I was crown'd I was but nine months old.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.
speaker: RICHARD

string: Father, tear the crown from the usurper's head.
speaker: RICHARD

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: Sweet father, do so; set it on your head.
speaker: EDWARD

string: MONTAGUE
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: Good brother, as thou lovest and honourest arms,
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: Let's fight it out and not stand cavilling thus.
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Sound drums and trumpets, and the king will fly.
speaker: RICHARD

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Sons, peace!
speaker: YORK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Peace, thou! and give King Henry leave to speak.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Plantagenet shall speak first: hear him, lords;
speaker: WARWICK

string: And be you silent and attentive too,
speaker: WARWICK

string: For he that interrupts him shall not live.
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Think'st thou that I will leave my kingly throne,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Wherein my grandsire and my father sat?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: No: first shall war unpeople this my realm;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ay, and their colours, often borne in France,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And now in England to our heart's great sorrow,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Shall be my winding-sheet. Why faint you, lords?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: My title's good, and better far than his.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Prove it, Henry, and thou shalt be king.
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Henry the Fourth by conquest got the crown.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: 'Twas by rebellion against his king.
speaker: YORK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: [Aside]  I know not what to say; my title's weak.--
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Tell me, may not a king adopt an heir?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: What then?
speaker: YORK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: An if he may, then am I lawful king;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: For Richard, in the view of many lords,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Resign'd the crown to Henry the Fourth,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Whose heir my father was, and I am his.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: He rose against him, being his sovereign,
speaker: YORK

string: And made him to resign his crown perforce.
speaker: YORK

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Suppose, my lords, he did it unconstrain'd,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Think you 'twere prejudicial to his crown?
speaker: WARWICK

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: No; for he could not so resign his crown
speaker: EXETER

string: But that the next heir should succeed and reign.
speaker: EXETER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Art thou against us, Duke of Exeter?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: His is the right, and therefore pardon me.
speaker: EXETER

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Why whisper you, my lords, and answer not?
speaker: YORK

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: My conscience tells me he is lawful king.
speaker: EXETER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: [Aside]  All will revolt from me, and turn to him.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Plantagenet, for all the claim thou lay'st,
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Think not that Henry shall be so deposed.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Deposed he shall be, in despite of all.
speaker: WARWICK

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Thou art deceived: 'tis not thy southern power,
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Of Essex, Norfolk, Suffolk, nor of Kent,
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Which makes thee thus presumptuous and proud,
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Can set the duke up in despite of me.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: King Henry, be thy title right or wrong,
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Lord Clifford vows to fight in thy defence:
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: May that ground gape and swallow me alive,
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Where I shall kneel to him that slew my father!
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: O Clifford, how thy words revive my heart!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Henry of Lancaster, resign thy crown.
speaker: YORK

string: What mutter you, or what conspire you, lords?
speaker: YORK

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Do right unto this princely Duke of York,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Or I will fill the house with armed men,
speaker: WARWICK

string: And over the chair of state, where now he sits,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Write up his title with usurping blood.
speaker: WARWICK

string: He stamps with his foot and the soldiers show themselves
KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: My Lord of Warwick, hear me but one word:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Let me for this my life-time reign as king.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Confirm the crown to me and to mine heirs,
speaker: YORK

string: And thou shalt reign in quiet while thou livest.
speaker: YORK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: I am content: Richard Plantagenet,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Enjoy the kingdom after my decease.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: What wrong is this unto the prince your son!
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: What good is this to England and himself!
speaker: WARWICK

string: WESTMORELAND
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: Base, fearful and despairing Henry!
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: How hast thou injured both thyself and us!
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WESTMORELAND
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: I cannot stay to hear these articles.
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Nor I.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Come, cousin, let us tell the queen these news.
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WESTMORELAND
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: Farewell, faint-hearted and degenerate king,
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: In whose cold blood no spark of honour bides.
speaker: WESTMORELAND

string: NORTHUMBERLAND
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: Be thou a prey unto the house of York,
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: And die in bands for this unmanly deed!
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: In dreadful war mayst thou be overcome,
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Or live in peace abandon'd and despised!
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: Exeunt NORTHUMBERLAND, CLIFFORD, and WESTMORELAND
WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Turn this way, Henry, and regard them not.
speaker: WARWICK

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: They seek revenge and therefore will not yield.
speaker: EXETER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ah, Exeter!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Why should you sigh, my lord?
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Not for myself, Lord Warwick, but my son,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Whom I unnaturally shall disinherit.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: But be it as it may: I here entail
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The crown to thee and to thine heirs for ever;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Conditionally, that here thou take an oath
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To cease this civil war, and, whilst I live,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To honour me as thy king and sovereign,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And neither by treason nor hostility
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To seek to put me down and reign thyself.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: This oath I willingly take and will perform.
speaker: YORK

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Long live King Henry! Plantagenet embrace him.
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And long live thou and these thy forward sons!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Now York and Lancaster are reconciled.
speaker: YORK

string: EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: Accursed be he that seeks to make them foes!
speaker: EXETER

string: Sennet. Here they come down
YORK
speaker: YORK

string: Farewell, my gracious lord; I'll to my castle.
speaker: YORK

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: And I'll keep London with my soldiers.
speaker: WARWICK

string: NORFOLK
speaker: NORFOLK

string: And I to Norfolk with my followers.
speaker: NORFOLK

string: MONTAGUE
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: And I unto the sea from whence I came.
speaker: MONTAGUE

string: Exeunt YORK, EDWARD, EDMUND, GEORGE, RICHARD,  WARWICK, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, their Soldiers, and Attendants
KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And I, with grief and sorrow, to the court.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Enter QUEEN MARGARET and PRINCE EDWARD
EXETER
speaker: EXETER

string: Here comes the queen, whose looks bewray her anger:
speaker: EXETER

string: I'll steal away.
speaker: EXETER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Exeter, so will I.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Nay, go not from me; I will follow thee.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Be patient, gentle queen, and I will stay.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Who can be patient in such extremes?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Ah, wretched man! would I had died a maid
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And never seen thee, never borne thee son,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Seeing thou hast proved so unnatural a father
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Hath he deserved to lose his birthright thus?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Hadst thou but loved him half so well as I,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Or felt that pain which I did for him once,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Or nourish'd him as I did with my blood,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Thou wouldst have left thy dearest heart-blood there,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Rather than have that savage duke thine heir
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And disinherited thine only son.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Father, you cannot disinherit me:
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: If you be king, why should not I succeed?
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Pardon me, Margaret; pardon me, sweet son:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The Earl of Warwick and the duke enforced me.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Enforced thee! art thou king, and wilt be forced?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: I shame to hear thee speak. Ah, timorous wretch!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Thou hast undone thyself, thy son and me;
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And given unto the house of York such head
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: As thou shalt reign but by their sufferance.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: To entail him and his heirs unto the crown,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: What is it, but to make thy sepulchre
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And creep into it far before thy time?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Warwick is chancellor and the lord of Calais;
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Stern Falconbridge commands the narrow seas;
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The duke is made protector of the realm;
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And yet shalt thou be safe? such safety finds
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The trembling lamb environed with wolves.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Had I been there, which am a silly woman,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The soldiers should have toss'd me on their pikes
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Before I would have granted to that act.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: But thou preferr'st thy life before thine honour:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And seeing thou dost, I here divorce myself
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Both from thy table, Henry, and thy bed,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Until that act of parliament be repeal'd
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Whereby my son is disinherited.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The northern lords that have forsworn thy colours
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Will follow mine, if once they see them spread;

ACT II
SCENE I. A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
A march. Enter EDWARD, RICHARD, and their power

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: Messenger

speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: Messenger
speaker: Messenger

string: Environed he was with many foes,
speaker: Messenger

string: And stood against them, as the hope of Troy
speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

string: Of unrelenting Clifford and the queen,
speaker: Messenger

string: Who crown'd the gracious duke in high despite,
speaker: Messenger

string: The ruthless queen gave him to dry his cheeks
speaker: Messenger

string: The saddest spectacle that e'er I view'd.

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: Sweet Duke of York, our prop to lean upon,

speaker: EDWARD

string: O Clifford, boisterous Clifford! thou hast slain
speaker: EDWARD

string: The flower of Europe for his chivalry;
speaker: EDWARD

string: And treacherously hast thou vanquish'd him,
speaker: EDWARD

string: For hand to hand he would have vanquish'd thee.
speaker: EDWARD

string: Now my soul's palace is become a prison:
speaker: EDWARD

string: Ah, would she break from hence, that this my body
speaker: EDWARD

string: Might in the ground be closed up in rest!
speaker: EDWARD

string: For never henceforth shall I joy again,
speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: I cannot weep; for all my body's moisture
speaker: RICHARD

string: Scarce serves to quench my furnace-burning heart:
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: For selfsame wind that I should speak withal
speaker: RICHARD

string: Is kindling coals that fires all my breast,

string: And burns me up with flames that tears would quench.
speaker: RICHARD

string: To weep is to make less the depth of grief:
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: EDWARD

string: RICHARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Tidings, as swiftly as the posts could run,

string: Were brought me of your loss and his depart.

speaker: WARWICK

string: Muster'd my soldiers, gather'd flocks of friends,

speaker: WARWICK

string: Bearing the king in my behalf along;

string: To dash our late decree in parliament

string: Short tale to make, we at Saint Alban's met

string: Our battles join'd, and both sides fiercely fought:

speaker: WARWICK

string: Who look'd full gently on his warlike queen,

speaker: RICHARD

Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET,  PRINCE EDWARD, CLIFFORD, and NORTHUMBERLAND, with drum and trumpets

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Welcome, my lord, to this brave town of York.

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: CLIFFORD

string: My gracious liege, this too much lenity

speaker: CLIFFORD

speaker: CLIFFORD

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: CLIFFORD

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Go, rate thy minions, proud insulting boy!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

string: You, that are king, though he do wear the crown,

speaker: CLIFFORD

speaker: RICHARD

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

speaker: RICHARD

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: WARWICK

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: WARWICK

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: Break off the parley; for scarce I can refrain
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: Upon that Clifford, that cruel child-killer.
speaker: RICHARD

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: I slew thy father, call'st thou him a child?
speaker: CLIFFORD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Ay, like a dastard and a treacherous coward,
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: CLIFFORD
speaker: CLIFFORD

speaker: CLIFFORD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

speaker: WARWICK

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Whoever got thee, there thy mother stands;
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

string: Iron of Naples hid with English gilt,
speaker: RICHARD

string: Whose father bears the title of a king,--
speaker: RICHARD

string: As if a channel should be call'd the sea,--
speaker: RICHARD

string: Shamest thou not, knowing whence thou art extraught,
speaker: RICHARD

string: To let thy tongue detect thy base-born heart?
speaker: RICHARD

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: A wisp of straw were worth a thousand crowns,
speaker: EDWARD

string: To make this shameless callet know herself.
speaker: EDWARD

string: Helen of Greece was fairer far than thou,
speaker: EDWARD

string: Although thy husband may be Menelaus;
speaker: EDWARD

string: And ne'er was Agamemnon's brother wrong'd
speaker: EDWARD

string: By that false woman, as this king by thee.
speaker: EDWARD

string: His father revell'd in the heart of France,
speaker: EDWARD

string: And tamed the king, and made the dauphin stoop;
speaker: EDWARD

string: And had he match'd according to his state,
speaker: EDWARD

string: He might have kept that glory to this day;
speaker: EDWARD

string: But when he took a beggar to his bed,
speaker: EDWARD

string: And graced thy poor sire with his bridal-day,
speaker: EDWARD

string: Even then that sunshine brew'd a shower for him,
speaker: EDWARD

string: That wash'd his father's fortunes forth of France,
speaker: EDWARD

string: And heap'd sedition on his crown at home.
speaker: EDWARD

string: For what hath broach'd this tumult but thy pride?
speaker: EDWARD

string: Hadst thou been meek, our title still had slept;
speaker: EDWARD

string: And we, in pity of the gentle king,
speaker: EDWARD

string: Had slipp'd our claim until another age.
speaker: EDWARD

string: GEORGE
speaker: GEORGE

speaker: GEORGE

speaker: GEORGE

speaker: GEORGE

string: And though the edge hath something hit ourselves,
speaker: GEORGE

speaker: GEORGE

string: We'll never leave till we have hewn thee down,

speaker: GEORGE

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: And, in this resolution, I defy thee;

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: No, wrangling woman, we'll no longer stay:
speaker: EDWARD

speaker: GEORGE

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: EDWARD
speaker: EDWARD

string: RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

speaker: WARWICK

string: GEORGE
speaker: GEORGE

Excursions. Enter RICHARD and CLIFFORD
RICHARD
speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD

string: Nay Warwick, single out some other chase;

SCENE V. Another part of the field.
Alarum. Enter KING HENRY VI alone
KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: This battle fares like to the morning's war,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: When dying clouds contend with growing light,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: What time the shepherd, blowing of his nails,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Can neither call it perfect day nor night.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Now sways it this way, like a mighty sea
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Forced by the tide to combat with the wind;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Now sways it that way, like the selfsame sea
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Forced to retire by fury of the wind:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Sometime the flood prevails, and then the wind;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Now one the better, then another best;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Both tugging to be victors, breast to breast,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Yet neither conqueror nor conquered:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So is the equal of this fell war.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Here on this molehill will I sit me down.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To whom God will, there be the victory!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: For Margaret my queen, and Clifford too,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Have chid me from the battle; swearing both
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: They prosper best of all when I am thence.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: For what is in this world but grief and woe?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: O God! methinks it were a happy life,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To be no better than a homely swain;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To sit upon a hill, as I do now,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To carve out dials quaintly, point by point,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thereby to see the minutes how they run,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: How many make the hour full complete;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: How many hours bring about the day;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: How many days will finish up the year;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: How many years a mortal man may live.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: When this is known, then to divide the times:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many hours must I tend my flock;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many hours must I take my rest;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many hours must I contemplate;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many hours must I sport myself;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many days my ewes have been with young;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So minutes, hours, days, months, and years,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Pass'd over to the end they were created,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ah, what a life were this! how sweet! how lovely!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Gives not the hawthorn-bush a sweeter shade
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To shepherds looking on their silly sheep,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Than doth a rich embroider'd canopy
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To kings that fear their subjects' treachery?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: O, yes, it doth; a thousand-fold it doth.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And to conclude, the shepherd's homely curds,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: His cold thin drink out of his leather bottle.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: His wonted sleep under a fresh tree's shade,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: All which secure and sweetly he enjoys,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Is far beyond a prince's delicates,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: His viands sparkling in a golden cup,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: His body couched in a curious bed,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Alarum. Enter a Son that has killed his father, dragging in the dead body
Son
speaker: Son

string: Ill blows the wind that profits nobody.
speaker: Son

string: This man, whom hand to hand I slew in fight,
speaker: Son

string: May be possessed with some store of crowns;
speaker: Son

speaker: Son

speaker: Son

string: To some man else, as this dead man doth me.
speaker: Son

string: Who's this? O God! it is my father's face,
speaker: Son

string: Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.
speaker: Son

string: O heavy times, begetting such events!
speaker: Son

string: From London by the king was I press'd forth;
speaker: Son

string: My father, being the Earl of Warwick's man,
speaker: Son

speaker: Son

speaker: Son

speaker: Son

string: Pardon me, God, I knew not what I did!
speaker: Son

string: And pardon, father, for I knew not thee!
speaker: Son

string: My tears shall wipe away these bloody marks;
speaker: Son

string: And no more words till they have flow'd their fill.
speaker: Son

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: O piteous spectacle! O bloody times!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Poor harmless lambs abide their enmity.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Weep, wretched man, I'll aid thee tear for tear;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And let our hearts and eyes, like civil war,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Be blind with tears, and break o'ercharged with grief.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

Father
speaker: Father

string: Thou that so stoutly hast resisted me,
speaker: Father

string: Give me thy gold, if thou hast any gold:
speaker: Father

string: For I have bought it with an hundred blows.
speaker: Father

speaker: Father

string: Ah, boy, if any life be left in thee,
speaker: Father

speaker: Father

string: Blown with the windy tempest of my heart,
speaker: Father

string: Upon thy words, that kill mine eye and heart!
speaker: Father

string: O, pity, God, this miserable age!
speaker: Father

string: What stratagems, how fell, how butcherly,
speaker: Father

speaker: Father

speaker: Father

string: O boy, thy father gave thee life too soon,
speaker: Father

speaker: Father

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Woe above woe! grief more than common grief!

speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: O pity, pity, gentle heaven, pity!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: Son

speaker: WARWICK

string: KING EDWARD IV

string: The harder match'd, the greater victory:
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: My mind presageth happy gain and conquest.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Enter SOMERSET, with drum and colours
SOMERSET
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Somerset, Somerset, for Lancaster!
speaker: SOMERSET

string: He and his forces enter the city
GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Two of thy name, both Dukes of Somerset,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Have sold their lives unto the house of York;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And thou shalt be the third if this sword hold.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Enter CLARENCE, with drum and colours
WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: And lo, where George of Clarence sweeps along,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Of force enough to bid his brother battle;
speaker: WARWICK

string: With whom an upright zeal to right prevails
speaker: WARWICK

string: More than the nature of a brother's love!
speaker: WARWICK

string: Come, Clarence, come; thou wilt, if Warwick call.
speaker: WARWICK

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Father of Warwick, know you what this means?
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Taking his red rose out of his hat
Look here, I throw my infamy at thee
speaker: CLARENCE

string: I will not ruinate my father's house,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Who gave his blood to lime the stones together,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And set up Lancaster. Why, trow'st thou, Warwick,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: That Clarence is so harsh, so blunt, unnatural,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: To bend the fatal instruments of war
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Against his brother and his lawful king?
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Perhaps thou wilt object my holy oath:
speaker: CLARENCE

string: To keep that oath were more impiety
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Than Jephthah's, when he sacrificed his daughter.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: I am so sorry for my trespass made
speaker: CLARENCE

string: That, to deserve well at my brother's hands,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: I here proclaim myself thy mortal foe,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: With resolution, wheresoe'er I meet thee--
speaker: CLARENCE

string: As I will meet thee, if thou stir abroad--
speaker: CLARENCE

string: To plague thee for thy foul misleading me.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And so, proud-hearted Warwick, I defy thee,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And to my brother turn my blushing cheeks.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Pardon me, Edward, I will make amends:
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And, Richard, do not frown upon my faults,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: For I will henceforth be no more unconstant.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Now welcome more, and ten times more beloved,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Than if thou never hadst deserved our hate.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Welcome, good Clarence; this is brotherlike.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: O passing traitor, perjured and unjust!
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: What, Warwick, wilt thou leave the town and fight?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Or shall we beat the stones about thine ears?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Alas, I am not coop'd here for defence!
speaker: WARWICK

string: I will away towards Barnet presently,
speaker: WARWICK

string: And bid thee battle, Edward, if thou darest.
speaker: WARWICK

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Yes, Warwick, Edward dares, and leads the way.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Lords, to the field; Saint George and victory!
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Exeunt King Edward and his company. March. Warwick and his company follow
SCENE II. A field of battle near Barnet.
Alarum and excursions. Enter KING EDWARD IV, bringing forth WARWICK wounded
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: So, lie thou there: die thou, and die our fear;
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: For Warwick was a bug that fear'd us all.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Now, Montague, sit fast; I seek for thee,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: That Warwick's bones may keep thine company.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Exit
WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Ah, who is nigh? come to me, friend or foe,
speaker: WARWICK

string: And tell me who is victor, York or Warwick?
speaker: WARWICK

string: Why ask I that? my mangled body shows,
speaker: WARWICK

string: My blood, my want of strength, my sick heart shows.
speaker: WARWICK

string: That I must yield my body to the earth
speaker: WARWICK

string: And, by my fall, the conquest to my foe.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Thus yields the cedar to the axe's edge,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Whose arms gave shelter to the princely eagle,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Under whose shade the ramping lion slept,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Whose top-branch overpeer'd Jove's spreading tree
speaker: WARWICK

string: And kept low shrubs from winter's powerful wind.
speaker: WARWICK

string: These eyes, that now are dimm'd with death's black veil,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Have been as piercing as the mid-day sun,
speaker: WARWICK

string: To search the secret treasons of the world:
speaker: WARWICK

string: The wrinkles in my brows, now filled with blood,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Were liken'd oft to kingly sepulchres;
speaker: WARWICK

string: For who lived king, but I could dig his grave?
speaker: WARWICK

string: And who durst mine when Warwick bent his brow?
speaker: WARWICK

string: Lo, now my glory smear'd in dust and blood!
speaker: WARWICK

string: My parks, my walks, my manors that I had.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Even now forsake me, and of all my lands
speaker: WARWICK

string: Is nothing left me but my body's length.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Why, what is pomp, rule, reign, but earth and dust?
speaker: WARWICK

string: And, live we how we can, yet die we must.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Enter OXFORD and SOMERSET
SOMERSET
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Ah, Warwick, Warwick! wert thou as we are.
speaker: SOMERSET

string: We might recover all our loss again;
speaker: SOMERSET

string: The queen from France hath brought a puissant power:
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Even now we heard the news: ah, could'st thou fly!
speaker: SOMERSET

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Why, then I would not fly. Ah, Montague,
speaker: WARWICK

string: If thou be there, sweet brother, take my hand.
speaker: WARWICK

string: And with thy lips keep in my soul awhile!
speaker: WARWICK

string: Thou lovest me not; for, brother, if thou didst,
speaker: WARWICK

string: Thy tears would wash this cold congealed blood
speaker: WARWICK

string: That glues my lips and will not let me speak.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Come quickly, Montague, or I am dead.
speaker: WARWICK

string: SOMERSET
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Ah, Warwick! Montague hath breathed his last;
speaker: SOMERSET

string: And to the latest gasp cried out for Warwick,
speaker: SOMERSET

string: And said 'Commend me to my valiant brother.'
speaker: SOMERSET

string: And more he would have said, and more he spoke,
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Which sounded like a clamour in a vault,
speaker: SOMERSET

string: That mought not be distinguished; but at last
speaker: SOMERSET

string: I well might hear, delivered with a groan,
speaker: SOMERSET

string: 'O, farewell, Warwick!'
speaker: SOMERSET

string: WARWICK
speaker: WARWICK

string: Sweet rest his soul! Fly, lords, and save yourselves;
speaker: WARWICK

string: For Warwick bids you all farewell to meet in heaven.
speaker: WARWICK

string: Dies
OXFORD
speaker: OXFORD

string: Away, away, to meet the queen's great power!
speaker: OXFORD

string: Here they bear away his body. Exeunt
SCENE III. Another part of the field.
Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV in triumph; with GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and the rest
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Thus far our fortune keeps an upward course,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And we are graced with wreaths of victory.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: But, in the midst of this bright-shining day,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: I spy a black, suspicious, threatening cloud,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: That will encounter with our glorious sun,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Ere he attain his easeful western bed:
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: I mean, my lords, those powers that the queen
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Hath raised in Gallia have arrived our coast
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And, as we hear, march on to fight with us.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: A little gale will soon disperse that cloud
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And blow it to the source from whence it came:
speaker: CLARENCE

string: The very beams will dry those vapours up,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: For every cloud engenders not a storm.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: The queen is valued thirty thousand strong,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And Somerset, with Oxford fled to her:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: If she have time to breathe be well assured
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Her faction will be full as strong as ours.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: We are advertised by our loving friends
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: That they do hold their course toward Tewksbury:
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: We, having now the best at Barnet field,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Will thither straight, for willingness rids way;
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And, as we march, our strength will be augmented
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: In every county as we go along.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Strike up the drum; cry 'Courage!' and away.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Exeunt
SCENE IV. Plains near Tewksbury.
March. Enter QUEEN MARGARET, PRINCE EDWARD, SOMERSET, OXFORD, and soldiers
QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Great lords, wise men ne'er sit and wail their loss,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: But cheerly seek how to redress their harms.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: What though the mast be now blown overboard,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The cable broke, the holding-anchor lost,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And half our sailors swallow'd in the flood?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Yet lives our pilot still. Is't meet that he
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Should leave the helm and like a fearful lad
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: With tearful eyes add water to the sea
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And give more strength to that which hath too much,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Whiles, in his moan, the ship splits on the rock,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Which industry and courage might have saved?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Ah, what a shame! ah, what a fault were this!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Say Warwick was our anchor; what of that?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And Montague our topmost; what of him?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Our slaughter'd friends the tackles; what of these?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Why, is not Oxford here another anchor?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And Somerset another goodly mast?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The friends of France our shrouds and tacklings?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And, though unskilful, why not Ned and I
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: For once allow'd the skilful pilot's charge?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: We will not from the helm to sit and weep,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: But keep our course, though the rough wind say no,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: From shelves and rocks that threaten us with wreck.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: As good to chide the waves as speak them fair.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And what is Edward but ruthless sea?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: What Clarence but a quicksand of deceit?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And Richard but a ragged fatal rock?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: All these the enemies to our poor bark.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Say you can swim; alas, 'tis but a while!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Tread on the sand; why, there you quickly sink:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Bestride the rock; the tide will wash you off,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Or else you famish; that's a threefold death.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: This speak I, lords, to let you understand,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: If case some one of you would fly from us,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: That there's no hoped-for mercy with the brothers
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: More than with ruthless waves, with sands and rocks.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Why, courage then! what cannot be avoided
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: 'Twere childish weakness to lament or fear.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Methinks a woman of this valiant spirit
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Should, if a coward heard her speak these words,
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Infuse his breast with magnanimity
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: And make him, naked, foil a man at arms.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: I speak not this as doubting any here
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: For did I but suspect a fearful man
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: He should have leave to go away betimes,
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Lest in our need he might infect another
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: And make him of like spirit to himself.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: If any such be here--as God forbid!--
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Let him depart before we need his help.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: OXFORD
speaker: OXFORD

string: Women and children of so high a courage,
speaker: OXFORD

string: And warriors faint! why, 'twere perpetual shame.
speaker: OXFORD

string: O brave young prince! thy famous grandfather
speaker: OXFORD

string: Doth live again in thee: long mayst thou live
speaker: OXFORD

string: To bear his image and renew his glories!
speaker: OXFORD

string: SOMERSET
speaker: SOMERSET

string: And he that will not fight for such a hope.
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Go home to bed, and like the owl by day,
speaker: SOMERSET

string: If he arise, be mock'd and wonder'd at.
speaker: SOMERSET

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Thanks, gentle Somerset; sweet Oxford, thanks.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: And take his thanks that yet hath nothing else.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Enter a Messenger
Messenger
speaker: Messenger

string: Prepare you, lords, for Edward is at hand.
speaker: Messenger

string: Ready to fight; therefore be resolute.
speaker: Messenger

string: OXFORD
speaker: OXFORD

string: I thought no less: it is his policy
speaker: OXFORD

string: To haste thus fast, to find us unprovided.
speaker: OXFORD

string: SOMERSET
speaker: SOMERSET

string: But he's deceived; we are in readiness.
speaker: SOMERSET

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: This cheers my heart, to see your forwardness.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: OXFORD
speaker: OXFORD

string: Here pitch our battle; hence we will not budge.
speaker: OXFORD

string: Flourish and march. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and soldiers
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Brave followers, yonder stands the thorny wood,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Which, by the heavens' assistance and your strength,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Must by the roots be hewn up yet ere night.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: I need not add more fuel to your fire,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: For well I wot ye blaze to burn them out
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Give signal to the fight, and to it, lords!
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Lords, knights, and gentlemen, what I should say
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: My tears gainsay; for every word I speak,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Ye see, I drink the water of mine eyes.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Therefore, no more but this: Henry, your sovereign,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Is prisoner to the foe; his state usurp'd,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: His realm a slaughter-house, his subjects slain,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: His statutes cancell'd and his treasure spent;
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And yonder is the wolf that makes this spoil.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: You fight in justice: then, in God's name, lords,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Be valiant and give signal to the fight.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Alarum. Retreat. Excursions. Exeunt
SCENE V. Another part of the field.
Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE,  and soldiers; with QUEEN MARGARET, OXFORD, and SOMERSET, prisoners
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Now here a period of tumultuous broils.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Away with Oxford to Hames Castle straight:
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: For Somerset, off with his guilty head.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Go, bear them hence; I will not hear them speak.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: OXFORD
speaker: OXFORD

string: For my part, I'll not trouble thee with words.
speaker: OXFORD

string: SOMERSET
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Nor I, but stoop with patience to my fortune.
speaker: SOMERSET

string: Exeunt Oxford and Somerset, guarded
QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: So part we sadly in this troublous world,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: To meet with joy in sweet Jerusalem.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Is proclamation made, that who finds Edward
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Shall have a high reward, and he his life?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: It is: and lo, where youthful Edward comes!
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Enter soldiers, with PRINCE EDWARD
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Bring forth the gallant, let us hear him speak.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: What! can so young a thorn begin to prick?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Edward, what satisfaction canst thou make
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: For bearing arms, for stirring up my subjects,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And all the trouble thou hast turn'd me to?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Speak like a subject, proud ambitious York!
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Suppose that I am now my father's mouth;
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Resign thy chair, and where I stand kneel thou,
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee,
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Ah, that thy father had been so resolved!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: That you might still have worn the petticoat,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And ne'er have stol'n the breech from Lancaster.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Let AEsop fable in a winter's night;
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: His currish riddles sort not with this place.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: By heaven, brat, I'll plague ye for that word.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Ay, thou wast born to be a plague to men.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: For God's sake, take away this captive scold.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Nay, take away this scolding crookback rather.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Peace, wilful boy, or I will charm your tongue.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Untutor'd lad, thou art too malapert.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: PRINCE EDWARD
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: I know my duty; you are all undutiful:
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: Lascivious Edward, and thou perjured George,
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: And thou mis-shapen Dick, I tell ye all
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: I am your better, traitors as ye are:
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: And thou usurp'st my father's right and mine.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Take that, thou likeness of this railer here.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Stabs him
GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Sprawl'st thou? take that, to end thy agony.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Stabs him
CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And there's for twitting me with perjury.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Stabs him
QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: O, kill me too!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Marry, and shall.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Offers to kill her
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Hold, Richard, hold; for we have done too much.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Why should she live, to fill the world with words?
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: What, doth she swoon? use means for her recovery.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Clarence, excuse me to the king my brother;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: I'll hence to London on a serious matter:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Ere ye come there, be sure to hear some news.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: What? what?
speaker: CLARENCE

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: The Tower, the Tower.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Exit
QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: O Ned, sweet Ned! speak to thy mother, boy!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Canst thou not speak? O traitors! murderers!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: They that stabb'd Caesar shed no blood at all,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Did not offend, nor were not worthy blame,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: If this foul deed were by to equal it:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: He was a man; this, in respect, a child:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And men ne'er spend their fury on a child.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: What's worse than murderer, that I may name it?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: No, no, my heart will burst, and if I speak:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: And I will speak, that so my heart may burst.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Butchers and villains! bloody cannibals!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: How sweet a plant have you untimely cropp'd!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: You have no children, butchers! if you had,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: The thought of them would have stirr'd up remorse:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: But if you ever chance to have a child,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Look in his youth to have him so cut off
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Away with her; go, bear her hence perforce.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Nay, never bear me hence, dispatch me here,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Here sheathe thy sword, I'll pardon thee my death:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: What, wilt thou not? then, Clarence, do it thou.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: By heaven, I will not do thee so much ease.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Good Clarence, do; sweet Clarence, do thou do it.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Didst thou not hear me swear I would not do it?
speaker: CLARENCE

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Ay, but thou usest to forswear thyself:
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: 'Twas sin before, but now 'tis charity.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: What, wilt thou not? Where is that devil's butcher,
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Hard-favour'd Richard? Richard, where art thou?
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Thou art not here: murder is thy alms-deed;
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Petitioners for blood thou ne'er put'st back.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Away, I say; I charge ye, bear her hence.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: QUEEN MARGARET
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: So come to you and yours, as to this Prince!
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

string: Exit, led out forcibly
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Where's Richard gone?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: To London, all in post; and, as I guess,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: To make a bloody supper in the Tower.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: He's sudden, if a thing comes in his head.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Now march we hence: discharge the common sort
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: With pay and thanks, and let's away to London
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And see our gentle queen how well she fares:
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: By this, I hope, she hath a son for me.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Exeunt
SCENE VI. London. The Tower.
Enter KING HENRY VI and GLOUCESTER, with the Lieutenant, on the walls
GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Good day, my lord. What, at your book so hard?
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ay, my good lord:--my lord, I should say rather;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: 'Tis sin to flatter; 'good' was little better:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: 'Good Gloucester' and 'good devil' were alike,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And both preposterous; therefore, not 'good lord.'
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Sirrah, leave us to ourselves: we must confer.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Exit Lieutenant
KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So flies the reckless shepherd from the wolf;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: So first the harmless sheep doth yield his fleece
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And next his throat unto the butcher's knife.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: What scene of death hath Roscius now to act?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: The thief doth fear each bush an officer.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The bird that hath been limed in a bush,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: With trembling wings misdoubteth every bush;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And I, the hapless male to one sweet bird,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Have now the fatal object in my eye
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Where my poor young was limed, was caught and kill'd.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Why, what a peevish fool was that of Crete,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: That taught his son the office of a fowl!
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: An yet, for all his wings, the fool was drown'd.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: I, Daedalus; my poor boy, Icarus;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thy father, Minos, that denied our course;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The sun that sear'd the wings of my sweet boy
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thy brother Edward, and thyself the sea
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Whose envious gulf did swallow up his life.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ah, kill me with thy weapon, not with words!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: My breast can better brook thy dagger's point
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Than can my ears that tragic history.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: But wherefore dost thou come? is't for my life?
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Think'st thou I am an executioner?
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: A persecutor, I am sure, thou art:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: If murdering innocents be executing,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Why, then thou art an executioner.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Thy son I kill'd for his presumption.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Hadst thou been kill'd when first thou didst presume,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thou hadst not lived to kill a son of mine.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And thus I prophesy, that many a thousand,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Which now mistrust no parcel of my fear,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And many an old man's sigh and many a widow's,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And many an orphan's water-standing eye--
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Men for their sons, wives for their husbands,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And orphans for their parents timeless death--
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Shall rue the hour that ever thou wast born.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The owl shriek'd at thy birth,--an evil sign;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The night-crow cried, aboding luckless time;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Dogs howl'd, and hideous tempest shook down trees;
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: The raven rook'd her on the chimney's top,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And chattering pies in dismal discords sung.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thy mother felt more than a mother's pain,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And, yet brought forth less than a mother's hope,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To wit, an indigested and deformed lump,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Not like the fruit of such a goodly tree.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Teeth hadst thou in thy head when thou wast born,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: To signify thou camest to bite the world:
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: And, if the rest be true which I have heard,
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Thou camest--
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: I'll hear no more: die, prophet in thy speech:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Stabs him
For this amongst the rest, was I ordain'd.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING HENRY VI
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Ay, and for much more slaughter after this.
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: God forgive my sins, and pardon thee!
speaker: KING HENRY VI

string: Dies
GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: What, will the aspiring blood of Lancaster
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Sink in the ground? I thought it would have mounted.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: See how my sword weeps for the poor king's death!
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: O, may such purple tears be alway shed
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: From those that wish the downfall of our house!
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: If any spark of life be yet remaining,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Down, down to hell; and say I sent thee thither:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Stabs him again
I, that have neither pity, love, nor fear.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Indeed, 'tis true that Henry told me of;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: For I have often heard my mother say
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: I came into the world with my legs forward:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Had I not reason, think ye, to make haste,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And seek their ruin that usurp'd our right?
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: The midwife wonder'd and the women cried
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: 'O, Jesus bless us, he is born with teeth!'
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And so I was; which plainly signified
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: That I should snarl and bite and play the dog.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Then, since the heavens have shaped my body so,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Let hell make crook'd my mind to answer it.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: I have no brother, I am like no brother;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And this word 'love,' which graybeards call divine,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Be resident in men like one another
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And not in me: I am myself alone.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Clarence, beware; thou keep'st me from the light:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: But I will sort a pitchy day for thee;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: For I will buz abroad such prophecies
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: That Edward shall be fearful of his life,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And then, to purge his fear, I'll be thy death.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: King Henry and the prince his son are gone:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Clarence, thy turn is next, and then the rest,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Counting myself but bad till I be best.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: I'll throw thy body in another room
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And triumph, Henry, in thy day of doom.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Exit, with the body
SCENE VII. London. The palace.
Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, QUEEN ELIZABETH,  CLARENCE, GLOUCESTER, HASTINGS, a Nurse with the young Prince, and Attendants
KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Once more we sit in England's royal throne,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Re-purchased with the blood of enemies.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: What valiant foemen, like to autumn's corn,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Have we mow'd down, in tops of all their pride!
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Three Dukes of Somerset, threefold renown'd
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: For hardy and undoubted champions;
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Two Cliffords, as the father and the son,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And two Northumberlands; two braver men
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Ne'er spurr'd their coursers at the trumpet's sound;
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: That in their chains fetter'd the kingly lion
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And made the forest tremble when they roar'd.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Thus have we swept suspicion from our seat
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And made our footstool of security.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Come hither, Bess, and let me kiss my boy.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Young Ned, for thee, thine uncles and myself
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Have in our armours watch'd the winter's night,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Went all afoot in summer's scalding heat,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: That thou mightst repossess the crown in peace;
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And of our labours thou shalt reap the gain.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: [Aside]  I'll blast his harvest, if your head were laid;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: For yet I am not look'd on in the world.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: This shoulder was ordain'd so thick to heave;
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And heave it shall some weight, or break my back:
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Work thou the way,--and thou shalt execute.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Clarence and Gloucester, love my lovely queen;
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And kiss your princely nephew, brothers both.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: The duty that I owe unto your majesty
speaker: CLARENCE

string: I seal upon the lips of this sweet babe.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: QUEEN ELIZABETH
speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

string: Thanks, noble Clarence; worthy brother, thanks.
speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

string: GLOUCESTER
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: And, that I love the tree from whence thou sprang'st,
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Witness the loving kiss I give the fruit.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: Aside
And cried 'all hail!' when as he meant all harm.
speaker: GLOUCESTER

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Now am I seated as my soul delights,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Having my country's peace and brothers' loves.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: CLARENCE
speaker: CLARENCE

string: What will your grace have done with Margaret?
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Reignier, her father, to the king of France
speaker: CLARENCE

string: Hath pawn'd the Sicils and Jerusalem,
speaker: CLARENCE

string: And hither have they sent it for her ransom.
speaker: CLARENCE

string: KING EDWARD IV
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Away with her, and waft her hence to France.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: And now what rests but that we spend the time
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: With stately triumphs, mirthful comic shows,
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Such as befits the pleasure of the court?
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Sound drums and trumpets! farewell sour annoy!
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: For here, I hope, begins our lasting joy.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV

string: Exeunt
